text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Tripureshwor | other_name = | native_name = त्रिपुरेश्वर | nickname = | settlement_type = Village development committee | motto = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | subdivision_type1 = Zone | subdivision_name1 = Bagmati Zone | subdivision_name2 = Dhading District | area_total_sq_mi = | population_as_of = 1991 | population_total = 2707 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_blank1_title = Ethnicities | population_blank2_title = Religions | population_blank2 = Hindu }} Tripureshwar is a village in Dhading District in the Bagmati Zone of central Nepal. left |thumb |190px |Netravati River in Mangalore At the time of the 1991 Nepal census it had a population of 2707 and had 497 houses in it. The biggest river of the district, Netrawati river passes from this village. ==References== Category:Geography of Nepal Category:Villages in Asia
title: Tripureswar
